title: See the faces of children victimized by Russia's invasion
description: CNN's Sara Sidner reports on the children victimized by Russian attacks in Bucha and speaks with a grandmother who says a Russian sniper killed her 7-year-old grandchild.

title: The latest in the investigations and lawsuits involving Trump, his company and the 2020 election
Ivanka Trump talked to Jan. 6 panel about what was happening inside White House that day, chairman says
description: The Trump family's cooperation with the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol -- and Ivanka Trump's appearance in particular -- has proven useful in confirming other key testimony about the state of play inside the White House as well as then-President Donald Trump's state of mind that day.

title: Most Americans have now had Covid-19 -- but experts are predicting the next surge
description: While it's tempting to say much of life is getting back to normal, it's probably more accurate to say it feels more comfortable and normal living alongside Covid-19.

title: Ex-police officer who fatally shot unarmed 12-year-old in back charged, DA says
description: A former Philadelphia police officer who fatally shot a 12-year-old boy in the back in March has been charged with first-degree murder, District Attorney Larry Krasner announced Monday, saying the boy was unarmed and on the ground when the officer fired.

title: 'Pissed-off' Manchin rails on Trump-backed candidate in House GOP primary
description: Last week, Sen. Joe Manchin was angry.

title: Sisters reunite with stranger who helped them 20 years ago
description: A CNN story helped two sisters from the former Yugoslavia find the mystery woman who gave them a life-changing gift on an airplane 23 years ago.

title: Their virus symptoms were minor. Then they had long Covid.
description: Linda Timmer wanted to practice what she preached.

title: CNN reporter on what it's like reporting from inside Russia
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports from Moscow on the attempts by Russia's foreign minister to justify the Russian actions in Ukraine and explains what he's found in the city since his return.

title: Tennessee's governor has halted executions for an independent review into lethal injections following an inmate's last-minute reprieve
description: Tennessee's governor has announced a pause of executions in the state amid plans for an independent review into the lethal injection process.

title: CDC moves tourism hot spot out of 'high' risk level for Covid-19
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention lowered the Covid-19 travel risk for one of the most popular destinations in the Western Hemisphere on Monday.

title: Here's how to retire long before your 60s
description: There is no shortcut for saving money for retirement. But some people have found ways to do the hard work faster.

title: Drew Barrymore apologizes for comment about Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's trial
description: Drew Barrymore has apologized for "making light" of Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial.

title: Supreme Court says Boston violated First Amendment rights of group seeking to raise a Christian flag outside City Hall
description: The Supreme Court unanimously ruled Monday that Boston violated the First Amendment rights of a group seeking to briefly raise a Christian flag atop a city flagpole outside of City Hall as a part of a city program celebrating Boston's greater community.

title: Meet an 'extreme' plant that thrives and grows faster under stress
description: Not all plants wither when faced with harsh conditions. Extremophyte plants not only survive in dry, salty or cold places, but actually thrive in them.

title: 'Anna' reveals an unseen side of fashion's most influential figure
description: "The amazing thing about Anna is the average person knows who she is," designer Tom Ford tells fashion journalist Amy Odell in the first pages of "Anna," a new biography of American Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour out this week. "You show them a picture and they say, 'That's Anna Wintour from Vogue.'"

title: Inmate who disappeared with corrections officer had previously plotted to escape
description: Authorities in Alabama are searching for a corrections officer and an inmate charged with murder after they went missing on Friday.

title: As Georgia's investigation into Trump ramps up, new texts show chaos around a call
description: As Donald Trump badgered Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger on an hour-long call to "find" the votes necessary to flip the battleground state to Trump's column after the 2020 election, a Raffensperger aide fired off a plea for help.

title: Judge rules January 6 committee can obtain RNC and Trump campaign email data
description: A federal judge has decided to allow the House Select Committee investigating the Capitol Hill insurrection to obtain the Republican National Committee's marketing email data leading up to January 6, 2021.

title: Spirit rejects JetBlue's offer, saying it wants less lucrative deal with Frontier
description: Spirit Airlines said it will stick with its deal to be purchased by Frontier Airlines, rejecting a more lucrative competing offer from JetBlue Airways.

title: Warrant issued for prison guard who went missing with murder suspect inmate
UEFA bans Russian football clubs from all competitions
description: Russian national teams and clubs have been banned from participating in UEFA competitions "until further notice," European's football's governing body announced on Monday.

title: Ex-NYPD officer guilty of assaulting police officer at US Capitol riot
description: A former New York City police officer was convicted Monday of assaulting a Washington, DC, police officer during the January 6 riot at the US Capitol.

title: Germany will support an EU oil embargo on Russia
description: Germany is ready to support a European ban on imports of Russian oil, and won't be "blackmailed" by Moscow into paying for natural gas in rubles.

title: Scientists say they have nailed down the ideal amount of sleep in middle and old age
description: The optimum amount of sleep is not too little but not too much -- at least in middle and old age.

title: Prisoner of war confirmed dead days after Russian capture
description: Ukrainian prisoner of war Don Zvonyk was confirmed dead days after he was shown captured by Russian forces. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: China silences prominent market analyst as economic slump deepens
description: Chinese social media have shut down the accounts of a prominent market analyst who drew attention in recent weeks to the dramatic slowdown in the country's economy and the effects of government policy on the tech industry.

title: This ad tells you a whole lot about Joe Biden's political problems
description: In a new TV ad, Sen. Maggie Hassan tries to put some distance between herself and President Joe Biden.

title: Woman saves a life after DoorDash pizza delivery turns into medical emergency
description: Sophia Furtado, a DoorDash driver in Massachusetts, used knowledge from her time training as an emergency medical technician to save a customer's life when she found a woman unresponsive in her driveway. CNN affiliate WJAR reports.

title: The most important line from the White House Correspondents' Dinner
description: For the first time in more than two years, official Washington gathered Saturday night for the White House Correspondents' Dinner.

title: New York teacher put on leave after parents allege he made 7th-graders pick seeds out of cotton
description: A Rochester, New York, teacher has been placed on leave, according to a statement from the Rochester City School District Board of Education, after parents alleged he made his students pick seeds out of cotton during a lesson one parent said was about slavery.

title: Hearing today may be the last chance for Tulsa Race Massacre's survivors to get justice
description: A district court judge Monday could determine the fate of a reparations lawsuit filed by survivors and descendants of the 1921 Tulsa race massacre and whether the suit will go forward to trial.

title: Axios: Former Secretary of Defense Esper in new book says Trump wanted to shoot protesters
description: Former Defense Secretary Mark Esper says in his new book that then-President Donald Trump raised the idea of shooting protesters who took to the streets around the White House after the killing of Georgia Floyd in 2020, according to Axios.

title: Reporter reveals Zelensky's fears from the first days of the invasion
description: Simon Shuster, a TIME reporter, speaks with CNN's John Berman about his experience embedding with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and reveals more about the mindset of the Ukrainian leader during the first days of the Russian invasion.

title: Vegetarian and meat-eating children have similar growth and nutrition but not weight, study finds
description: If you're wondering how your child might fare on a vegetarian diet, a new study offers some factors to consider. Children eating a vegetarian diet and children who ate meat were similar in terms of growth, height and nutritional measures, but vegetarian children had higher odds of being underweight, according to a study published Monday in the journal Pediatrics.

title: Naomi Judd remembered by daughters at Country Music Hall of Fame ceremony
description: Naomi Judd's daughters honored her during her induction into the Country Music Hall of Fame Sunday night, just one day after they announced her death.

title: EU says Apple Pay restrictions may harm competitors
description: The European Union is warning Apple about possible antitrust violations after an investigation into the iPhone maker's dominance in mobile retail payments.

title: Why the food crisis sparked by Russia's war hasn't hit Gulf states yet
description: When Russia's invasion of Ukraine triggered an international food crisis, some Middle Eastern importers were hit particularly hard. An economically shattered Lebanon is fighting to avert a bread crisis, war-torn Yemen is already grappling with "alarming heights" of food insecurity, and Egypt, which last year imported 80% of its wheat from Russia and Ukraine, is capping bread prices to dodge hunger at home.

title: Investing ethically won't buy protection in this market
description: As the economy began bouncing back from the coronavirus pandemic, interest in investment products that promoted good environmental, social and governance practices took off.

title: Rarely seen photos from the Met Gala show celebrities letting loose
description: The Met Gala, known as fashion's biggest night, returns to its typical slot -- the first Monday of May -- after two years of disruptions due to the pandemic. The event, held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City coincides with the opening of part two of the exhibition, "In America: An Anthology of Fashion," hosted by the museum's Costume Institute. Guests have been asked to dress in "Gilded Glamour and White Tie," referencing the lavish Gilded Age, a three-decade period at the end of the 19th century that transformed American infrastructure and society life.

title: Tennis player asks Rafa Nadal: How is it fair that Ukrainians are dying?
description: Rafael Nadal, Andy Murray, and Novak Djokovic have criticized Wimbledon's decision to ban players from Russia and Belarus due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Video shows evacuations from steel plant in Mariupol
description: CNN's Scott McLean reports on the evacuation of civilians in Mariupol, Ukraine. More than 100 civilians were evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant that has been under siege for weeks, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. The effort is being led by the International Committee of the Red Cross and the United Nations.

title: These Senate candidates like to mention Trump. A lot
description: In Ohio and Pennsylvania Republican Senate debates one name is on the lips of every candidate: Donald Trump. CNN's Gabby Orr explains why.

title: Jon Rahm holds his nerve to win 'stressful' Mexico Open after tense finish
description: Jon Rahm secured his first victory of the season in dramatic fashion at the inaugural Mexico Open on Sunday.

title: Dispatch from Ukraine: Here's what CNN is seeing on the ground in Lviv
description: The moment CNN's Sara Sidner arrived in Lviv, Ukraine this weekend, an air raid siren was going off -- an alert, she tweeted, that gives "a heightened sense of what it is to be alive and the possibility of random death."

title: Golden State Warriors overcome Draymond Green ejection to win 117-116 nail-biter against Memphis Grizzlies
description: The Golden State Warriors overcame the ejection of key forward Draymond Green to win a nail-biter against the Memphis Grizzlies, 117-116, on Sunday in Game 1 of their Western Conference semifinal in the NBA playoffs.

title: Why China is ignoring the science on Covid transmission and sanitizing everything
description: Hazmat suit-clad workers spraying clouds of disinfectant over city streets, building fronts, park benches and even parcels have become an everyday scene in pandemic-era China.

title: Jackie Robinson All-Star Game bat sells for $1.08 million
description: A bat used by baseball hero Jackie Robinson in the 1949 All-Star Game sold at auction on Saturday for $1.08 million, New Jersey-based Goldin Auctions said.

title: See behind the scenes as Lviv National Opera reopens
description: The Lviv National Opera opened for the first time since Russia began its assault on Ukraine. Dancers performed "Giselle" for an audience of 300 people. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: This space hotel is scheduled to open in 2025. Here's what it looks like inside
description: Waking up in a chic hotel room with a view of the solar system could be the future of travel, at least if space company Orbital Assembly has anything to say about it.

title: Walter Hagen: The 'flamboyant' golfer who 'poked golf's aristocracy in the eye'
description: When Walter Hagen won the PGA Championship for the second year in a row in 1925, he did what any champion would do: head out to celebrate.

title: India seized more than $700 million from one of China's biggest tech companies
description: India has seized more than $700 million from one of China's biggest tech companies after accusing it of moving money out of the country illegally.

title: Qantas reveals details of record-breaking Project Sunrise flights
description: Qantas has taken an important step toward launching Project Sunrise, its long-dreamed-of goal to establish direct flights between Australia and the cities of New York and London.

title: Dior hosts runway show in South Korea for the first time
description: Dior hosted a fashion show in South Korea for the very first time on Saturday, presenting its latest collection to a star-studded audience in Seoul.

title: The political environment is terrible for Democrats -- and it may get worse
description: Joe Biden's term has become a punchline -- even to the President.
